history.content: I don't know what kind of workload you're used to, but that sounds like absolute death. Replace one of 61C/170/Prob 140 with an easier tech or a humanities class and you'll be fine

children.subject: I'm currently taking 61C / C100 / 170 right now, and I think the workload is a good amount (granted 61C takes up most of my time). I'm not sure how much work STAT 140 is, but I'd definitely err on the side of not taking 4 techs.

I think it's unfair to say that you don't "learn" a tech if you're taking 4 techs. I have been taking 4 technicals since junior year: sometimes I do well in them, sometimes not so much, but I don't think that someone who took 2 technicals in that semester and received an A is better off than me if I received an A too. I think that grades are generally a good indicator of your performance, especially here at Cal where they are not inflated, and it's definitely possible to do well in 4 techs in terms of grades; sure, you'll probably have to sacrifice other stuff like ECs and recruiting, but you can do well.

OP, don't feel discouraged to take this workload. It will be hard but not impossible to do well in all of them. C100 is probably the easiest upper division class in terms of workload, and I have heard 140 is easy too after having taken 70.

speaking from personal experience, here is what I recommend. Don't do 4 technicals. In this I don't mean that it will be impossible to keep up with the material or that ur grades will suffer (they might or they might not), what I mean is that CS170, Data100, 61C are all courses that actually help you for industry/SWE/new fields of CS, and as a result you wanna absorb as much as you can out of those classes. Whether that be doing a personal project in that course or actually reading about related material in your free time. If you take all 4 classes at the same time, what will end up happening is that rather than enjoying the material and actually absorbing the material, you'll just be focused on getting the work over with and that lectures will just be "something " you HAVE to get finish so you can go on to the next one. Couple that ECs and social life, and you will end up not spending as much time on each topic as you can/should be. Instead of spending time on the homework and grinding through it, you'll spend ur time most likely trying to get it finished. All in all, unless ur FULLY committed to those 4 classes/academics, then don't take it. There's a difference between taking a tech and actually "learning" a tech.

I'm in 61b/70/stat 134 right now, which I imagine is comparable to but a bit lighter than 61c/170/140. My schedule has been lighter than I expected, and I think I could add a moderate workload tech like data 100 onto it without too much pain. 

Your schedule would be hard but not unmanageable, in my opinion, as long as you have good time management (unless I'm grossly under-estimating the difference between 61b/70 and 61c/170.)

I talked to Professor DeNero about Info 159, and he says the reason the CS department doesn't have an NLP class because of how good the 159 already is. Definitely worth taking imo, and probably lighter than most of the aforementioned classes. Also worth nothing that 159 is only in the fall, and 154 is only in the spring, as far as I'm aware

thanks for all the responses!  I took 6 APs last year in HS (didn't do that great actually, but good enough I guess) and last Fall I took 3 technicals (Data8, 61A, EE16A) which was quite doable because Data8 was easy-peasy.  If I had my druthers I would only take 3 technicals and a non-technical or maybe just 3 technicals and a Decal, but I more or less painted myself into a corner by pretty much using APs and/or community college classes to fulfill all breadths and every other requirement.  So now all that's left are upper div technicals, more or less.  So part of my question is trying to figure out which classes to take that's a balance of time-consuming and not-as-time-consuming.

Does anyone have any info on any of the INFO classes, say INFO 154 or INFO 159?  Also, it also seems like there's a lot of classes that has a prereq of 61C, so I'm not even sure what else I could take for the fall.

history.content:
how difficult would this load be for Fall 2019?

I'm a dual DS/CS guy and other than 61C, all my other classes remaining are upper div technicals (maybe I'll change my mind on that as time goes on).  170 I could hold off on, but the other 3 I'd want to finish off sooner than later.  I could also be convinced to take some other Probability course instead of STAT 140 as well.
history.subject: 61C / C100 / 170 / STAT140 courseload
